title: Peering symbol
content:
I am putting together an identity for a project that deals with establishing network connections between Internet nodes and it is tentatively called _The Peering Project_. The following is a symbol I am currently iterating over -

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425045853im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ikebana-3_5775.png)

and the black and white version -

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425045853im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ikebana-2_4510.png)

I am my own client, so life is hard and I need external opinions.

- For one, if it resembles anything existing (I can't think of anything).
- For two, if it's too generic or, preferably, unique enough to be memorable.
- For three, what's your first impression of it?

Thanks
author: apankrat

comments.content:
1. [This](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425045853/http:/i.istockimg.com/file_thumbview_approve/17442771/2/stock-illustration-17442771-design-elements-infinity-triangle.jpg) and [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425045853/http:/i.istockimg.com/file_thumbview_approve/16265473/2/stock-illustration-16265473-design-elements-striped-symbols-5.jpg) and perhaps the inner space shape reminded me of adobe air. Either way it looks and feels common to all.

2. Yep ...perhaps. But is that really a bad thing?

3. My first impression was ...OK whatever.
